question.text: In paragraphs 3 to 9, Socrates argues for his first premise, by comparing people with horses and dogs. What is his first premise?

concept.name: conclusion
concept.include: When men are harmed they become more unjust
People who are harmed come to be less just
Men and women who are injured become less just
We become less just when we are harmed by others
concept.exclude: This premise is about harm and justice
People are not the same as horses or dogs
